analysis.summary: Vue component that renders an SVG pause/navigation icon with a customizable fill color.
analysis.purpose: Provides a reusable, configurable pause/navigation icon for use throughout the application’s UI.

components.name: IconPause
components.description: A single-file Vue component (script setup) that outputs an inline SVG and accepts a `fill` prop to control the icon’s color.

functions.name: defineProps
functions.description: Vue 3 `<script setup>` compiler macro used to declare incoming props.

fill.description: Color used to fill the two `<path>` elements inside the SVG. Defaults to black via CSS variable.

dependencies: CSS custom property `--black` for default color
analysis.usage:
Import the component and include it in a parent template:

<script setup>
import IconPause from 'modules/icons/navigation/IconPause.vue'
</script>

<template>
  <!-- Default color -->
  <IconPause />
  <!-- Custom color -->
  <IconPause fill="#FF0000" />
</template>
notes: The default value for `fill` is declared as an object with a `position` key, but the prop is typed as `String`. This is likely a mistake; it should be a plain string like `'rgb(var(--black))'`.
No `<style>` block is present; icon styling is driven entirely by props and external CSS variables.
All markup is inline SVG, preventing additional HTTP requests for assets.
As a standalone icon component, it has no side effects and minimal overhead.
